cells.data:
Galileo's observations of Venus' phases showed that Venus must orbit the Sun
geocentric versus heliocentric
Also discovered moon has craters, Sun spots, Jupiter's moons, Saturn's rings, Milky Way's stars, Neptune

*Prograde Motion* is normal West to East motion
*Retrograde Motion* is (strange) East to West motion
*N.B.* This is only for over a series of nights, not daily motion (in which stars rise in E and set in W)
*altitude* height of the star (how far above the horizon)
*azimuth* degrees clockwise from North

Retrograde motion occurs *when a planet passes another*
